title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 February 2017 - XWiki
content:
<flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
01:50 <flyingpot> has quit  
06:10 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
06:12 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
06:26 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
07:31 <edvorg> has quit  
07:52 <sorinello> has quit  
07:54 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <sorinello> has quit  
07:54 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
08:26 <vmassol> hi guys quite a few failing tests on master, especially on extensions (+6): http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/ . Maybe tmortagne  can have a look?  
08:26 <vmassol> they're probably flickers but they all seem to happen; maybe that info could help to fix the issue?  
08:27 <vmassol> I'll fix the mail test issue  
08:44 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <KermitTheFragger> hi all  
09:11 <KermitTheFragger> what is the reason usernames with a dot are not allowed in xwiki?  
09:12 <KermitTheFragger> will it cause major breakage if I would modify the code to accept them?  
09:43 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <flyingpot\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <flyingpot> has quit  
09:56 <flyingpot\_> has quit  
09:56 <vmassol> hmm seems there's a problem with the bot which is failing to compute URLs... will need to look into that  
09:58 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <flyingpot\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <flyingpot> has quit  
10:06 <flyingpot\_> has quit  
10:08 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <flyingpot> has quit  
10:18 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> KermitTheFragger: I think this is theorically possible, the main reason is because dots are used as separator character between spaces and pages  
10:19 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> KermitTheFragger: dots can be escaped so a page can have a dot in its name  
10:19 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> and since a user IS a page technically, it should be doable  
10:20 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> now maybe there is some code, somewhere, that assumes there is no dot in a username, and then don't do the proper escaping  
10:20 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> it could be in some extensions we don't control  
10:20 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> and even in our own code  
10:21 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> ... hmm KermitTheFragger is offline  
10:21 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> ok I should get used to riot :)  
10:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <flyingpot> has quit  
10:50 <vmassol> he'll be able to see your answer in the IRC logs :)  
10:50 <vmassol> ah stupid me, I pinged thomas above but he's on holidays ;)  
10:56 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki

14:00 <vmassol> FYI I'm moving to trying to  understand some job failures on ci.xwiki.org, espêcia  
14:00 <vmassol> \*especially why the Clover job is failing  
14:15 <martinus\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:17 <vmassol> ok the problem is simply that enteprise master has not been built yet apparenrtly  
14:17 <vmassol> ah it's failing, checking why  
14:27 <vmassol> seems thomas made a mistake when he modified the build during the release  
14:28 <vmassol> in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/dea008cbbc649ba236421fd273d2e528e089806c or https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/71ba1c22456a195f6f1d9781061443a1e978fa85  
14:33 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
14:35 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> vmassol: Enygma: I've resumed the discussion there: http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/NotificationCenterforAppsImplementation#HIteration3  
14:41 <vmassol> ok  
14:41 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> I mean Summarized  
14:43 <Enygma`> k  
14:46 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> my only reserve concerning riot.im is that it seems we cannot use Nickserv  
14:46 <Enygma`> yes, you can  
14:46 <Enygma`> accept the invite request from Freenode IRC Bridge status  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <Enygma`> then you can use it to perform IRC commands, including talking to nickserv  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> good  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> is now known as <gdelhumeau\_old>  
14:51 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> Unrecognised command: /nickserv  
14:51 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> same with /msg  
14:51 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: check the doc I sent yesterday  
14:51 <vmassol> let me find it  
14:52 <vmassol> https://solson.me/2016/10/08/irccloud-to-matrix.html  
14:52 <Enygma`> use !nick to change your nickname. Then Nickserv will contact you. Talk to Nickserv "verify <password>". then you can !storepass on the IRC bridge to save the password.  
14:52 <Enygma`> correction: "identify <password>"  
14:53 <gdelhumeau\_[m]> is now known as <gdelhumeau>  
14:54 <vmassol> cool didn't know about !storepass  
14:55 <gdelhumeau\_old> thx  
14:55 <vmassol> we should probably docmnet this at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/IRC  
14:56 <gdelhumeau\_old> has quit  
14:56 <gdelhumeau> ok now I am more confortable with riot :)  
14:56 <Enygma`> would have been really nice to allow anonymous users as well  
14:57 <vmassol> wdym? irc allows anonymous users  
14:57 <Enygma`> I`ve already gave up pidgin  
14:57 <Enygma`> I mean using riot  
14:57 <vmassol> ah yes  
14:58 <Enygma`> Who can access this room?  
14:58 <Enygma`> Anyone who knows the room's link, apart from guests  
14:58 <vmassol> to replace the embedded IRC client we have on our page  
14:58 <Enygma`> is the current setting  
14:58 <Enygma`> maybe we can make a request to change it, until we move to some private matrix instance  
14:58 <Enygma`> but maybe it`s not that urgent anyway  
14:59 <vmassol> Enygma: I don't see the issue since there's an IRC bridge  
15:00 <vmassol> (which allows anonymous users)  
15:00 <vmassol> so for me it's minor  
15:07 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
15:11 <flyingpot> has quit  
15:24 <floflobel> has quit  
15:25 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
16:14 <msmeria1> has quit  
17:13 <vmassol> we have a problem on playground, seems users can modify the home now, need to check that  
17:13 <vmassol> I guess we should only allow users to modify the sandbox space  
17:17 <vmassol> hmmm the blog too and the help center too  
17:17 <vmassol> ah not the help center  
17:18 <vmassol> evalica: the help center only creates content in the sandbox space right?  
17:19 <evalica> it contains link to edit sandbox pages and also link to create new pages. But yes, the default values are set on Sandbox  
17:21 <vmassol> evalica:  
17:21 <vmassol> new pages where?  
17:21 <vmassol> the user picks the location?  
17:22 <evalica> http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Help/Templates/#HExamples click on Try it! button from top  
17:22 <vmassol> ok that's sadnbox  
17:22 <evalica> the location is sugested, but he could change it  
17:22 <vmassol> that's fine  
17:23 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:23 <evalica> vmassol: apparently someone create some templates. I wonder how they could have access the Administration - Template provider  
17:23 <evalica> I'm happy that they did it :) but not sure they should have had the rights  
17:24 <vmassol> yes I noticed that some users were able to change the language in the past too  
17:24 <vmassol> we need to find how they do this  
17:24 <evalica> loool … no never mind - it's in the code  
17:24 <evalica> it's Marius code … sorry  
17:24 <evalica> we created them :)  
17:25 <evalica> the language thing I guess it's a cache bug  
17:25 <vmassol> lol :)  
17:26 <vmassol> ok I've updated the instructions  
17:26 <vmassol> so that the users can only edit blog and sandbox spaces  
17:26 <vmassol> so now we'll need to resave the DB....  
17:26 <evalica> well it's not really playground in this case  
17:27 <evalica> if we restore it, they could play with it  
17:27 <evalica> the problem is that Main.WebHome has the register instructions  
17:27 <vmassol> I guess the best would be for me to wait till midnight and do it just at that time ;)  
17:27 <vmassol> that + when the wiki is defaced it's not nice  
17:27 <vmassol> it doesn't represent the default wiki any more  
17:27 <vmassol> the playground is not a personal wiki  
17:28 <vmassol> we don't offer that  
17:28 <vmassol> you need to register on xwiki cloud for thzt  
17:28 <vmassol> you need to register on xwiki cloud for that  
17:28 <vmassol> (xwiki sas cloud that is)  
17:28 <evalica> we don't offer a personal, since it's reseted every day  
17:29 <vmassol> you should have checked playground a few minutes ago :)  
17:29 <vmassol> (before I reverted the home)  
17:29 <vmassol> was a mess  
17:29 <evalica> well … that means testing  
17:29 <vmassol> "we don't offer a personal, since it's reseted every day"  
17:29 <vmassol> no that's not the reason  
17:29 <vmassol> the reason is that it's hard to offer a personal wiki and it costs resourcesd  
17:30 <vmassol> no that doesn't mean testing  
17:30 <vmassol> it means testing only for the person who did this  
17:31 <vmassol> but not for the one coming after and seing that and leaving without doing anything  
17:31 <vmassol> which is exactly what happened  
17:31 <vmassol> but that person commented on a site so I saw it  
17:31 <vmassol> and that's why I noticed that the permissions were not correct anymore  
17:32 <evalica> I understand … still I think we should allow users to do stuff there, otherwise it's just a 'view' mode, they can't really 'play'  
17:32 <evalica> Administration is not accessible … anyway, as you said they have Cloud as option  
17:32 <Enygma`> vmassol: trying to use the openid connect authenticator. (bad timing with tmortagne being away). Any idea why, inside a resource handler (/xwiki/oidc/) I do not see a session attribute that was set in a previous request? i.e. authenticator sets session attribute, redirects to provider, that redirects back to the authenticator's wiki on the /xwiki/oidc/ resource, but the session is empty.  
17:32 <vmassol> we do  
17:33 <vmassol> we just don't allow them to break the home nor the dashboard  
17:33 <vmassol> they can play in the sandbox and in the blog  
17:33 <vmassol> exactly  
17:33 <vmassol> it's not a personal wiki  
17:33 <vmassol> :)  
17:34 <vmassol> Enygma: sorry no idea. If some value is set in the servlet session there's no reason you wouldn't see them inside any code  
17:35 <Enygma`> Authenticator: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/oidc/blob/master/oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/OIDCAuthServiceImpl.java#L171  
17:35 <Enygma`> Resource callback: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/oidc/blob/master/oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/endpoint/CallbackOIDCEndpoint.java#L91  
17:35 <Enygma`> the only difference I spot is that the resource callback gets the session directly from the Container  
17:35 <Enygma`> while the authenticator, initially, gets it from the XWikiContext's Request  
17:43 <gdelhumeau> BTW, how do we create an EventListerner that listen to every events?  
17:43 <gdelhumeau> currently the eventlister has to return a list of events that it listen  
17:52 <vmassol> good question :)  
17:56 <gdelhumeau> do we need to change something in commons?  
17:57 <Enygma`> I think you can do it with a Regex matcher listener  
17:58 <gdelhumeau> we have that?  
17:58 <Enygma`> hmm, that only works for filtering the documents  
17:59 <Enygma`> Looks like we already have it: org.xwiki.observation.event.AllEvent  
17:59 <vmassol> ah I was wondering if we had an AllEvent  
18:00 <vmassol> cool  
18:00 <gdelhumeau> I see  
18:00 <gdelhumeau> nic  
18:00 <gdelhumeau> \*nice  
18:17 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: you wrote "Use one of AS param1 to param5 to log the audience foreign key."  
18:17 <gdelhumeau> no  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> it's an N\*N relationship  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> it's the audience which will have a foreign key to the activity ie, not the other way  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> s/ie/id  
18:21 <Silicium> has joined #xwiki  
18:21 <Silicium> hi there  
18:23 <Silicium> i'am running a xwiki testinstallation for evaluation purpose and deleted \_all\_ pages. so now the wiki is entirely empty  
18:24 <Silicium> why is that possible? and why can i even delete the administration page? i'am not able to install any extension or manage the application at all  
18:24 <gdelhumeau> Silicium: yes in XWiki you are able to delete all pages  
18:24 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ok please correct my mistake then!  
18:25 <vmassol> thanks  
18:25 <gdelhumeau> even those which are important  
18:25 <vmassol> Silicium: you can either  
18:25 <vmassol> 1) reinstall the pages  
18:25 <vmassol> 2) undelete them from the trash using a script  
18:25 <gdelhumeau> Silicium: but in the next release (in 1 week or so) you will have a confirmation message about that problem eveytime you want to delete important page  
18:26 <vmassol> if you're curious about the scripted restore: http://snippets.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Restore+Documents  
18:27 <Silicium> thx!  
18:28 <Silicium> vmassol: i dont have groovy installed yet, how can i execute the script?  
18:28 <Silicium> i mean i can install groovy but i need properties too to connect to the db etc ?
